title: Chapter 1: Neural Networks
text: In this chapter, we introduce the basic concepts of neural networks, including the architecture of a simple feedforward network and the activation functions used to compute its output.

title: Chapter 2: Backpropagation
text: In this chapter, we discuss the backpropagation algorithm used to train neural networks, including the calculation of gradients and the use of learning rate schedules.

title: Chapter 1: Algorithms and Programming Languages
text: This chapter covers the fundamentals of algorithms and programming languages. Topics include data structures, control structures, functions, and recursion.

title: Chapter 2: Information Structures
text: This chapter covers information structures and their uses. Topics include arrays, lists, trees, and graphs.

title: Chapter 1: The Wave Function
text: In this chapter, we will explore the wave function, which is a fundamental concept in quantum mechanics. We will learn how it is used to describe the state of a quantum system, and how it can be used to calculate probabilities of measurement outcomes.

title: Chapter 2: Operators and Observables
text: In this chapter, we will introduce the concept of operators in quantum mechanics, which are used to describe physical observables such as position and momentum. We will explore how these operators act on the wave function, and how they are related to the measurements that can be made on a quantum system.
